meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

Okay, okay, let's get this review party started! I'm diving headfirst into From Software's Bloodborne, a game that's got everyone (except maybe GameCritics) raving like a Victorian-era aristocrat at a masquerade ball.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Who is this groggy critic and why should I care?" Well, let me tell you, I'm not your average, run-of-the-mill reviewer. I'm a seasonal critic, which means I only review games during my favorite season... the gaming season! Wink-wink, nudge-nudge.

Seriously though, Bloodborne is one of those rare gems that'll hook you from the get-go. It's like that one friend who always shows up with an endless supply of pizza and a wicked sense of humor. You know, the kind that'll make you laugh so hard your belly hurts... while simultaneously making you question your life choices.

But I digress! Let's talk about the gameplay. Bloodborne is all about mastering the art of combat, dodging, and weaving (not literally, though - those pesky npcs are ruthless). It's a challenging experience that'll push you to the limits of your sanity (or at least make you question it).

Now, I know some critics might say Bloodborne is too tough, that it caters only to "twitch experts" and leaves the rest of us hanging like a rag doll. Well, let me tell you: those same critics are just trying to get attention (I mean, who doesn't love a good controversy, am I right?). Trust me, with patience and practice, anyone can become a master Bloodborne warrior.

So, what's the verdict? Should you give Bloodborne a whirl? Well, that's up to you, my friend! If you're the type who enjoys a good challenge (and by "good," I mean ridiculously hard), then Bloodborne is the game for you. Just remember: it's not just about the score - it's about the experience!

Stay groovy, and keep on gaming!
